title: Joshua's Favorite Tilapia With Jasmine Rice
summary: Joshua's Favorite Tilapia With Jasmine Rice might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe makes 1 servings with 1011 calories, 48g of protein, and 21g of fat each. For $4.75 per serving, this recipe covers 30% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. If you have pepper, salt, water, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the salt you could follow this main course with the Apple Turnovers Recipe as a dessert. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian diet. Overall, this recipe earns a pretty good spoonacular score of 72%. Try Joshua's Favorite Tilapia With Jasmine Rice, Tilapia with Jasmine Rice, and Perfectly Cooked Coconut Jasmine Rice without a Rice Cooker for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Tilapia works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.

instructions: Pour your dressing straight from the bottle into the pan, I usually make sure the bottom is covered but not too much, I gave approximate measures here.Place the fillets on top of the dressing in the pan.Sprinkle with all 4 seasonings (all the measurements I gave are approximate). I usually just sprinkle a generous amount on each filet. Don't leave out the cumin it is a wonderful addition to the fish.Saute the fillets on med-low heat approximate 4-5 minutes each side until fish flakes easy with a fork.While the fish is slowly cooking, cook the rice, using 2 1/2 cups water and 1 cup rice, with butter, bring to a boil and simmer 15 minutes on low.Serve the fillet on top of the Jasmine rice. I will usually add more s&p and cumin according to my taste.

steps.step: Pour your dressing straight from the bottle into the pan, I usually make sure the bottom is covered but not too much, I gave approximate measures here.
Place the fillets on top of the dressing in the pan.

Sprinkle with all 4 seasonings (all the measurements I gave are approximate). I usually just sprinkle a generous amount on each filet. Don't leave out the cumin it is a wonderful addition to the fish.

Saute the fillets on med-low heat approximate 4-5 minutes each side until fish flakes easy with a fork.While the fish is slowly cooking, cook the rice, using 2 1/2 cups water and 1 cup rice, with butter, bring to a boil and simmer 15 minutes on low.
Serve the fillet on top of the Jasmine rice. I will usually add more s&p and cumin according to my taste.
